dt: {bc}an official chosen to {a_link|preside} over a meeting or assembly
{bc}an appointed governor of a subordinate political unit
{bc}the chief officer of an organization (such as a corporation or institution) usually entrusted with the direction and administration of its policies
{bc}an elected official serving as both chief of state and chief political executive in a republic having a {a_link|presidential} government
{bc}an elected official having the position of chief of state but usually only minimal political powers in a republic having a parliamentary government

et: Middle English, from Anglo-French, from Latin {it}praesident-, praesidens{/it}, from present participle of {it}praesidēre{/it}
shortdef: an official chosen to preside over a meeting or assembly
an appointed governor of a subordinate political unit
the chief officer of an organization (such as a corporation or institution) usually entrusted with the direction and administration of its policies

dt: {bc}a person who has been elected president but who has not officially become president yet

shortdef: a person who has been elected president but who has not officially become president yet

dt: {bc}an officer next in rank to a president and usually empowered to serve as president in that officer's absence or disability
{bc}any of several officers serving as a president's deputies in charge of particular locations or functions

shortdef: an officer next in rank to a president and usually empowered to serve as president in that officer's absence or disability
any of several officers serving as a president's deputies in charge of particular locations or functions

dt: {bc}a person who is one of two or more {d_link|presidents|president} of something (such as a company or organization)

dt.t: … a 1997 HBS graduate who was {wi}copresident{/wi} of the Women's Student Association.

shortdef: a person who is one of two or more presidents of something (such as a company or organization)
